newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Ireland gives up on protection of regional food.
newsitem.headline: Ireland gives up on protection of regional food.

text.p: The Irish EU Presidency will hand over a proposal to protect geographical food origins to the incoming Dutch presidency, an EU official said on Wednesday.
"The proposal failed to get through the Special Agriculture Committee on Tuesday and the Irish announced that they would be leaving it to the Dutch," the official said.
The Commission has proposed that the new rules should apply after a five year transitional period following publication in the EU Official Journal on July 25, 1997.
The original regulation 2081/92 set up a five year transitional period expiring in July next year.
The regulation protects food products with a specific geographic identity.
The proposal created controversy over the question of feta cheese which is traditionally made from sheep's milk in Greece.
Denmark which has developed a major industry based on a feta type cheese made from cows' milk, has sought to delay the the measure for as long as possible.
